content: trelawny is a wide triangular shawl shaped to sit well on the shoulders it is worked from the top down with increases at the edges and centre of the shawl on every row this shawl was designed for gradient yarns but it would also work well in one solid colour or striped using mini skeins/ scrap yarn this shawl takes approximately 200g of 4 ply/fingering weight yarn sample used scheepjes whirl in the green tea tipple colourway but could be made in any size and any weight of yarn
